ValidationResult.Disclaimer: This validation test provides no warranty that all constraints were checked for given profiles. Additional testing may be required. Any issues should be reported to testing entity.

TestDescription.Name: Results and VitalSigns description should be coded in either CPT or LOINC where applicable
TestDescription.Description: Results and VitalSigns description should be coded in either CPT or LOINC where applicable Source: E2369-05 Table A1.1 Page 27

Error.Message: ResultType [BB0008] does not appear to be coded in CPT or LOINC
ResultType [BB0005] does not appear to be coded in CPT or LOINC
ResultType [BB0002] does not appear to be coded in CPT or LOINC

TestDescription.Name: Problem description should be coded in either ICD9-CM, ICD-10, or SNOMED
TestDescription.Description: Checks to see if Problem description has at least one code with a CodingSystem of either ICD9-CM, ICD-10, SNOMED, or SNOMED-CT Source: E2369-05 Table A1.1 Page 15

Error.Message: Problem [BB0001] does not appear to be coded in either ICD9, ICD-9, ICD9-CM, ICD10, ICD-10, SNOMED-CT, or SNOMED

TestDescription.Name: Problem description must be coded in either ICD9-CM, or SNOMED
TestDescription.Description: 'Checks to see if Problem description has at least one code with a CodingSystem of either ICD9-CM, SNOMED, or SNOMED-CT. As referenced in 42CFR-Part 162.1002(a)(1)' Source: RIN 0991-AB58 Sec 170.205(2)(i)(A) and (B)

Error.Message: Problem [BB0001] does not appear to be coded in either ICD9-CM, ICD-10, or SNOMED

TestDescription.Name: Procedure must be supported by the certified EHR technology but are not required for each CCR
TestDescription.Description: Checks to see if Procedures are provided in the CCR Source: RIN 0991-AB58 Sec 170.205(2)(ii)

Error.Message: No Procedures were found therefore cannot evaluate compliance with Procedure criteria

TestDescription.Name: Medication List must be supported by the certified EHR technology but are not required for each CCR
TestDescription.Description: Checks to see if Medication are provided in the CCR Source: RIN 0991-AB58 Sec 170.205(2)(iv)

Error.Message: No Medications were found therefore cannot evaluate compliance with Medication List criteria

Rule.Name: ActorReference requires a valid ActorObjectID
Rule.Title: ActorReference requires a valid ActorObjectID
Rule.Description: This test makes sure that every <ActorReference><ActorID> contains a value equal to an <Actor><ActorObjectID>
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: ActorReference should have an ActorRole
Rule.Title: ActorReference should have an ActorRole
Rule.Description: This test checks for ActorReferences without at least one ActorRole, which is recommended for each use of ActorReference
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: Each Actor must have a unique ActorObjectID
Rule.Title: Each Actor must have a unique ActorObjectID
Rule.Description: This test makes sure an ActorObjectID value is not duplicated
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: ActorObjectID format validity
Rule.Title: Each Actor ActorObjectID must conform to the proper format
Rule.Description: The ID must be made up of characters in the set A-Z, a-z, 0-9, dash (-), underscore (_) and period (.). The first character must be from the set A-Z, a-z. It can be of any character length.
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: Valid Actor <Status> values
Rule.Title: Each Actor must have a unique ActorObjectID
Rule.Description: This is a CodedDescriptionType with restricted content that must be one of the defined structured text values. Active, Prior History No Longer Active, Unknown.
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: Each CCRDataObjectID must have a unique value
Rule.Title: Each CCRDataObjectID must have a unique value
Rule.Description: This test makes sure an CCRDataObjectID value is not duplicated.
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: A CCRDataObjectID must not equal an ActorObjectID
Rule.Title: A CCRDataObjectID must not equal an ActorObjectID
Rule.Description: This test makes sure an CCRDataObjectID value is not the same as an ActorObjectID.
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: CCR Version 1.0 must have of string V1.0 as Version
Rule.Title: CCR Version 1.0 must have of string V1.0 as Version
Rule.Description: This test makes sure that there is a fixed string of 'V1.0' in <Version>.
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: CCR must have an ExactDateTime
Rule.Title: CCR must have an ExactDateTime
Rule.Description: This test makes sure that there is an <ExactDateTime> for the CCR DateTime and it must be have precision to seconds.
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: CCR should not have any datetime children except ExactDateTime
Rule.Title: CCR should not have any datetime children except ExactDateTime
Rule.Description: This test makes sure that there are no <Age>, <ApproximateDateTime>, or <DateTimeRange> children for the CCR DateTime.
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: ExactDateTime must be in the format of ISO8601
Rule.Title: ExactDateTime must be in the format of ISO8601
Rule.Description: This test makes sure that ExactDateTime formatted according to ISO 8601
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: Direction stopIndicator if present can only be the string 'Yes'
Rule.Title: Stop Indicator for a direction must be 'yes'
Rule.Description: If a medication uses the <StopIndicator> the text value must be 'Yes'
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: Direction multiple direction modifier must be either 'AND', 'OR', or 'THEN'
Rule.Title: Direction multiple direction modifier must be either 'AND', 'OR', or 'THEN'
Rule.Description: Direction multiple direction modifier must be either 'AND', 'OR', or 'THEN'.
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: Direction when multiple direction modifier is 'THEN' there should be direction sequence position
Rule.Title: Direction when multiple direction modifier is 'THEN' there should be direction sequence position
Rule.Description: Direction when multiple direction modifier is 'THEN' there should be direction sequence position.
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: Functional status type must be one of the required strings
Rule.Title: Functional status type must be one of the required strings
Rule.Description: Functional status type must be one of the required strings: Ambulatory Status, Mental Status, Activities of Daily Living, Home/Living Situation, Ability to Care for Self.
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: Functional status description can only be used without a problem or test
Rule.Title: Functional status description can only be used without a problem or test
Rule.Description: Functional status description can only be used without a problem or test
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: Functional status status must be one of the required strings
Rule.Title: Functional status status must be one of the required strings
Rule.Description: Functional status type must be one of the required strings: Active, Chronic, Temporary, Resolved.
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: A Payer dateTime must be an exact datetime
Rule.Title: A Payer dateTime must be an exact datetime
Rule.Description: A Payer dateTime must be an exact datetime.
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: Payer type must be a valid structured text value
Rule.Title: Payer type must be a valid structured text value
Rule.Description: Payer type must be one of the following values: Self-Pay, Primary Health Insurance, Supplemental Health Insurance, Prescription, Drug Benefit, Mental Health Benefit, Long Term Care Benefit, Workers Compensation, Auto Insurance, Dental Insurance, Other.
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: Payer IDs must have a type
Rule.Title: Payer IDs must have a type
Rule.Description: Payer IDs must have a type
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: Every InternalCCRLink must point to an ObjectID
Rule.Title: InternalCCRLink must point to a CCRDataObjectID
Rule.Description: This test makes sure that every <InternalCCRLink><linkID> contains a value equal to a <CCRCodedDataObjectType> or <ActorObjectID>.
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: Medication type must of one of the required string values
Rule.Title: Check for recommended code set for medication type
Rule.Description: This test checks for one of the following Strings for <Type>: Medication, IV Fluid, Parental Nutrition, Supplemental Nutrition, Immunization, Disposable, Supplies, Device, Implantable Device, Durable Medical Equipment.
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: Medication status must of one of the required string values
Rule.Title: Check for recommended code set for medication status
Rule.Description: This test checks for one of the following Strings for <Status>: Active, Inactive, On Hold, Prior History No Longer Active.
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: Medication product code should be encoded in RXNORM or NDC
Rule.Title: Medication product code should be encoded in RXNORM or NDC
Rule.Description: This test checks for at least one code with a coding system of either RxNorm or NDC for a medication. An NCD Code or RxNorm Code (preferred) should be used for <ProductName>.
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: Patient aware in patient knowledge must be either Yes, No, or Unknown
Rule.Title: Patient aware in patient knowledge must be either Yes, No, or Unknown
Rule.Description: Patient aware in patient knowledge must be either Yes, No, or Unknown
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: Problem type must be one of the required string values
Rule.Title: Problem type must be one of the required string values
Rule.Description: Problem type must be one of the required string values: Problem, Condition, Diagnosis, Symptom, Finding, Complaint, Functional Limitation.
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: Problem description should be coded in either ICD-9, ICD9-CM, ICD-10, or SNOMED
Rule.Title: Problem description should be coded in either ICD9-CM, ICD-10, or SNOMED
Rule.Description: Checks to see if Problem description has at least one code with a CodingSystem of either ICD9-CM, ICD-10, SNOMED, or SNOMED-CT
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: Problem status must be one of the required string values
Rule.Title: Problem <Status> must one of the required values
Rule.Description: Text content of <Status> for Problem must be one of the defined structured text values: Active, Inactive, Chronic, Intermittent, Recurrent, Rule Out, Ruled Out, Resolved.
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: Results type must be one of the required string values
Rule.Title: Results type must be one of the required string values
Rule.Description: Results type must be one of the required string values: Hematology, Chemistry, Serology, Virology, Toxicology, Microbiology, Imaging - X-ray, Ultrasound, CT, MRI, Angiography, Cardiac Echo, Nuclear Medicine, Pathology, Procedure.
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: Results and VitalSigns description should be coded in either CPT or LOINC where applicable
Rule.Title: Results and VitalSigns description should be coded in either CPT or LOINC where applicable
Rule.Description: Results and VitalSigns description should be coded in either CPT or LOINC where applicable
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: Check for Schema Errors - DOM
Rule.Title: CCR Instance must validate against the CCR XSD
Rule.Description: This test makes sure a CCR instance validates against the CCR XML Schema and only if its passes this validation will additional tests be evaluated.
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: Check for Schema Errors - InputStream
Rule.Title: "CCR Instance must validate against the CCR XSD"
Rule.Description: "This test makes sure a CCR instance validates against the CCR XML Schema and only if its passes this validation will additional tests be evaluated."
Rule.Author: "openhealthdata"

Rule.Name: Check for Schema Errors - File
Rule.Title: "CCR Instance must validate against the CCR XSD"
Rule.Description: "This test makes sure a CCR instance validates against the CCR XML Schema and only if its passes this validation will additional tests be evaluated."
Rule.Author: "openhealthdata"

Rule.Name: Social History status must be one of the required string values
Rule.Title: Social History status must be one of the required string values
Rule.Description: Social History status must be one of the required string values: Active, Prior History No Longer Active, Unknown.
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: Test type must be one of the required string values
Rule.Title: Test type must be one of the required string values
Rule.Description: Test type must be one of the required string values: Observation, Result.
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: Test status must be one of the required string values
Rule.Title: Test status must be one of the required string values
Rule.Description: Test status must be one of the required string values: Pending, In Process Preliminary Results, Final Results, Corrected Results.
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: Medication Allergies MUST be encoded with UNII - Description
Rule.Title: Medication Allergies MUST be encoded in UNII
Rule.Description: This test checks for at least one code with a coding system of either UNII or unii for an allergy. An UNII Code must be used for medication alleries
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: Medication Allergies MUST be encoded with UNII - Agent
Rule.Title: Medication Allergies MUST be encoded in UNII
Rule.Description: This test checks for at least one code with a coding system of either UNII or unii for the <ProductName> in <Agent>. An UNII Code must be used for medication alleries
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: Medication product code should be encoded in RXNORM or NDC
Rule.Title: Medication product code MUST be encoded in RXNORM
Rule.Description: This test checks for at least one code with a coding system of either RxNorm or NDC. Criteria is any code set by an RxNorm drug data source provider that is identified by the NLM as being integrated within RxNorm
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: MU - No Medication List Found in CCR
Rule.Title: Medication List must be supported by the certified EHR technology but are not required for each CCR
Rule.Description: Checks to see if Medication are provided in the CCR
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: MU - Problem description MUST be coded in either ICD9-CM, or SNOMED
Rule.Title: Problem description must be coded in either ICD9-CM, or SNOMED
Rule.Description: 'Checks to see if Problem description has at least one code with a CodingSystem of either ICD9-CM, SNOMED, or SNOMED-CT. As referenced in 42CFR-Part 162.1002(a)(1)'
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: MU - No Problem Found in CCR
Rule.Title: Problems must be supported by the certified EHR technology but are not required for each CCR
Rule.Description: Checks to see if Problems are provided in the CCR
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: MU - Procedure description MUST be coded in either ICD9-CM, or CPT-4
Rule.Title: Procedure description must be coded in either ICD9-CM, or CPT-4
Rule.Description: 'Checks to see if Procedure description has at least one code with a CodingSystem of either ICD9-CM or CPT-4. As referenced in 42CFR-Part 162.1002(a)(2) and (5)'
Rule.Author: openhealthdata

Rule.Name: MU - No Procedure Found in CCR
Rule.Title: Procedure must be supported by the certified EHR technology but are not required for each CCR
Rule.Description: Checks to see if Procedures are provided in the CCR
Rule.Author: openhealthdata
